ca.mcgill.ecse211.team11

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team11.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Logs any data passed to it into a file to be later used for debugging purposes.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Justin Szeto

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logger

        public Logger()

    • Method Detail

      • logData

        public static void logData(java.lang.String message)
        Log the time and the data passed as parameter.

        Calculates the current time relative to the start time (if it has been set) and prints the current time and the data passed as message to file or to System.out.

        Parameters:
        message -

      • setLogWriter

        public static void setLogWriter(java.lang.String filename)
        Set the logger to write to a file.

        When this method is called, it will create a new file with the name filename and set the logger to write data into the new file. By default, if this method is not called, then the logger will print out data to System.out.

        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file to print log data into

      • setLogStartTime

        public static void setLogStartTime()
        Store the time when logging starts.

        This method can only be used once, preferably when the program starts running. Any subsequent calls after the first one will not have any effect. If this method is not called, then the start time is set to 0.
